channel.title: Ventrilo
channel.description:
Does anyone know how to obtain a free Ventrilo server that I can run off my own box? All the copies I have are limited to 8 'players', I heard there's cracked versions allowing 100?
If anyone has any information please PM me... I don't want to pay $15 a month to host a Ventrilo server.
Alternatively, what's the cheapest, best place to rent one from?

item.title: Ventrilo
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:11, topic:416615”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=518505.msg3769841#msg3769841 date=1317578291]

[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=518505.msg3769573#msg3769573 date=1317554896]

http://mumble.sourceforge.net/

Seriously, use Mumble, it’s free and open source, much more secure than others, and has better voice quality and lower latency (faster) than anything else. Oh, did I mention it’s also entirely cross-platform? It runs on windows, OSX, Linux, Android, iPhone etc etc.

Can anyone come up with a reason NOT to use it?
[/quote]This is one of those few situations where i agree that a specific open source application is far superior to the commercial competitors. Mumble really is the best voice chat software in existance at the moment.
[/quote]You would just have to post a tutorial if you wanted to use Mumble. People are stupid.[/quote]

I don’t want to chat with someone so stupid they can’t download and install a free client anyway, so if people are really that stupid, mumble might solve another problem!

Read full topic
